intro: Haplophyllum khorasanicum, commonly known as the Khorasan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It has narrow, hairy leaves and produces small, elongated fruits that contain several seeds. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern in its native habitat.
